data.title: Great spot
data.text: They have two counters, one for drinks and one for beans.  Not a lot of selection for food.  Great coffee though.  Lots of seating and free wifi.  Great for reading, conversing, or working.  Some tables outside.  Prices are very reasonable for coffee.

data.title: Great variety of tea and coffee
data.text: Every time I visit Petaluma, I make sure to stop in and pick up a different flavor of tea.  Last time I picked up coffee as a gift (was a big hit).

data.title: Take a deep breath!
data.text: This place has the best coffee and selection of freshly roasted beans I've ever seen. Wide choice of different types of tea as well, and a great place to hang with friends over a cuppa. They have mail order and terrific, friendly folks working there.

data.title: Best choices in coffee
data.text: My family members when visiting get coffee for me from here. Being very picky about the quality of coffee as my mother grew her own, I tend to often throw the espresso coffee after a couple of sips. This is the one place that has never disappointed me. Amazing the variety of coffee they have. The atmosphere is very friendly. Could use better ventilation though !

data.title: Off the beaten track, but well worth a visit
data.text: Just a block or two front the center of town, this coffee purveyor and roaster is delightful. A man was playing the piano which combined with the sound of the coffee roaster. A myriad of coffees and Twas to choose from and a knowledgeable staff to serve you. A delight.

data.title: Nice location excellent barista
data.text:
This Peet's in Petaluma is the second Peet's we tried since moving to Santa Rosa for a month. We thought the barista made a fine coffee drink.  The feel of this location was relaxed and not hurried nor did the staff seem overwhelmed during a 5 minute rush when suddenly the line went out the door.  
   My only small negative comment was about the sample coffee they had sitting out to try.  It was an estate grown coffee, dark roasted and with a really complex flavor that I loved.  The sample was sitting in the original French press it was made in.  Thus the sample I drank was cold, which changes the coffee flavor.  They were too busy while we were there to ask them to make a hot sample.
   This Peet's like the one on 4th ave. in downtown Santa Rosa had some street people sitting inside (rather than outside like at 4th Ave.) whose clothing wafted an odor that caused us to move across the room to another seat.  The people were nice enough unlike those outside the Santa Rosa store.  I had a conversation with them about the coffee.  But this is the second Peet's now I tried in this area where street people make the place not so comfortable to just sit around and relax in for 15 or 20 minutes.  I feel bad writing this, like I'm heartless.  Still I want to be able sit in a coffee bar and relax and not feel intimidated or uncomfortable about those around me.

data.title: Excellent Coffee Roasters
data.text:
The staff is very knowledgeable about their coffees.  They are very friendly and willing to make recommendations based on your coffee preferences.

They have fair trade and non-fair trade coffees in whole bean or they will grind for you.  They make their own blends of their coffee beans and have them easily identified.  We purchased the Up the River and Rooster II in whole bean; both excellent local blends.

We had a brewed drink - a mocha.  It was wonderfully balanced with not too much sweet or overpowering chocolate; the coffee and chocolate came through for a very enjoyable cup.

They were so helpful, nice and friendly - I will stop whenever I'm in the area just because.  And their clientele are pretty friendly too.

data.title: Best Coffee
data.text: This place is called Petaluma Coffee and Tea Company. The aroma of coffee being roasted invites you in and you will see friendly faces welcoming you. I will not call this a restaurant. You can have coffee or tea and buy freshly roasted coffee beans. Their pastries are delicious. When explained to them the type of coffee I liked, they recommended a blend which I liked after bringing it home and tasting it.

data.title: Colombian Medium - So Delicious
data.text:
The Colombian medium roast coffee is so smooth, and delicious. I strongly suggest getting it for home. 

The actual coffee shop has a few issues. It doesn't have reliable wifi. There are not enough plugs. It doesn't feel like a place to be for a while.

data.title: Good caffeine, good people, good local hangout
data.text:
Sure you can get a great cup of caffeine here, coffee or tea, and I have. But what's as much fun is stepping up to the counter and buying. You can be as vague as you want, "Ummm, my aunt and uncle are really into coffee but I don't drink it much, and I'm going to visit. What should I take?" 
These folks roast their own beans, they're local and believe in giving back to the community. And they sell very, very good coffee and tea. 
Loose tea lovers, this is a good place to sample new types. My latest discovery is the Duke of Earl -- one of the nicest Earl Greys I've met, and I've been hanging out with them more than 40 years. Lavender lovers, there's an Earl Grey Lavender, waiting for you.
